Articles.Content:
Hello. I recently upgraded to Windows 8 64 bit, and I'm experiencing a problem. When I try to make changes to my Kerbal Space Program folder, it says "You need permission to perform this action. You require permission from *my name* to make changes to this folder" The folder is labeled game data. The options it gives me are try again and cancel. I am the administrator and the only user account on this computer. The version of KSP is 1.0.2.842 and was not bought on steam. If somebody could help me out on this pesky problem I would greatly appreciate it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Computer Specifications:

CPU- Intel Celeron G1610

RAM- Corsair 12 gbs

GPU- NVIDIA Geforce GT640

Power Supply- 600 watt Corsair

HDD- Western Digital 1 TB

Mother Board- Gigabyte P75-D3

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T13:58:12Z" title="05/09/2015 01:58  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by deltadonut**

Hi deltadonut, this is not a KSP issue but a Windows operating system issue, so all I can do is point you to Windows forums where your error has been addressed.

This page looks like what you need, [**\[click here\]**](https://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows-vista/add-take-ownership-to-explorer-right-click-menu-in-vista/).

If that doesn't help then you'll have to try a proper Windows help forum, as we can really only help with KSP specific issues here.
